name: monotropa
distribution: Maine to California and from Florida to Alaska. It is absent from the southwest
intermountain west and the central Rocky mountains
light: Dappled Sunlight (Shade through upper canopy all day)
Deep shade (Less than 2 hours to no direct sunlight)
flower-description: 0.7 in. nodding solitary flower at end of a scaly stalk; 4-5 petals and 10 stamens; flowers usually occur in clusters
leaf-description: Scale-like waxy-white to pinkish-white; contains no chlorophyll; dries to a blackish color
uses: Has been used as a nervine in herbal medicine
